Detailed Description

Class RBTDeviceHandler This class encapsulates a use of BT registry to store BT device information.

Definition at line 416 of file bteng.h.

IMPORT_C TInt RBTDeviceHandler::SetDeviceSecurityL ( CBTDevice &  aDevice,
TBool  aAuthenticate,
TBool  aAuthorise,
TBool  aEncrypt 
)

Sets device Global Security settings. Device can be ordered to be authenticated (UI dialog, authorized (UI dialog) or encrypted (non-UI) Overwrites service level security settings. If security parameter values are set to EFalse service level security will be main security. Parameters:

Parameters:
aDevice Device which security issues will be modified.
aAuthenticate Need for authentication for the device connection.
aAuthorise Need for authorisation for the device connection.
aEncrypt Need for encryption for the device connection.
Returns:
TInt KErrNone if OK, else value indicating error situation.

IMPORT_C TInt RBTDeviceHandler::RemoveTrustFromDevicesL (  ) 

Cleans the trust device flag from all the devices in BT Registry. This is used when restore factory settings is done. Parameters:

Parameters:
none 
Returns:
TInt KErrNone if OK, else value indicating error situation.

IMPORT_C TInt RBTDeviceHandler::CloseBasebandConnectionL ( const CBTDevice &  aDevice  )

Parameters:

Returns:
TInt KErrNone if OK, else value indicating error situation.

IMPORT_C TInt RBTDeviceHandler::CloseAllBasebandConnectionsL (  ) 

Closes all Baseband connections. After this device should be connection-free. Parameters:

Returns:
TInt KErrNone if OK, else value indicating error situation.

IMPORT_C TInt RBTDeviceHandler::GetOpenBasebandConnectionsL ( CBTDeviceArray &  aDevices  ) 

Returns an array of BT Devices (including only BD Addresses) which are connected to this device. If there are no connections, KErrNotFound is returned. Parameters:

Parameters:
aDevices List of devices (including BD Address) which are connected.
Returns:
TInt KErrNone if OK, else value indicating error situation. KErrNotFound if there are no connections.
